title: Scholarly Writing & Critical Essays
description: Compose sophisticated academic texts with rhetorical precision.

exercises.title: Philosophical Critique
exercises.prompt: Write a critical essay responding to the following claim: 'In an age of information abundance, the pursuit of truth has become not only difficult but fundamentally meaningless.' Present a nuanced argument that engages with both the merits and limitations of this position.
guidelines: Demonstrate sophisticated understanding of epistemological issues
Use advanced rhetorical structures (fronting, cleft sentences, complex concessives)
Acknowledge the complexity of the issue while developing a clear thesis
Conclude with a synthesis that opens new avenues for inquiry

sampleOutline.introduction: Problematize the claim while acknowledging its perspicacity
sampleOutline.body1: Examine the apparent validity: information overload and epistemic uncertainty
sampleOutline.body2: Challenge the conclusion: why 'meaninglessness' is too strong
sampleOutline.body3: Develop your nuanced position on truth-seeking in contemporary contexts
sampleOutline.conclusion: Synthesis and implications for scholarly inquiry

exercises.title: Textual Exegesis
exercises.prompt: Perform a close reading of a literary or philosophical text of your choice (or a hypothetical passage), analyzing how its formal properties—structure, diction, rhetorical devices—relate to its thematic concerns.
guidelines: Identify specific formal elements and analyze their significance
Connect formal analysis to larger interpretive claims
Demonstrate awareness of how meaning emerges through form

sampleOutline.opening: Introduce the text and your analytical focus
sampleOutline.interpretation: How form produces or complicates meaning
sampleOutline.conclusion: Broader implications for understanding the text

exercises.title: Conceptual Framework
exercises.prompt: Develop a theoretical framework that synthesizes two seemingly antithetical positions on a topic of your choice (e.g., individual agency vs. structural determinism, objectivity vs. subjectivity in research).
guidelines: Clearly articulate the tension between the two positions
Identify potential points of synthesis or productive tension
Propose a framework that acknowledges both perspectives
Use sophisticated transitional and concessive structures
Demonstrate rhetorical precision in presenting complex ideas

sampleOutline.problem: Articulate the apparent irreconcilability of the positions
sampleOutline.analysis1: Examine what is perspicacious about each view
sampleOutline.implications: Consider how this framework might be applied
